item.title: When 1 + 1 > 2
item.description:
From my time at Greptile, I witnessed a team that achieved an astonishing amount. By that I mean the mixture of different members produced far more than what would have been possible with a team of the same size composed of clones of any single member. Unfortunately, I have also observed the contrary: teams that produce a questionable amount of output compared to what each member seems capable of alone.
Having had to run engineering teams, I needed to understand why this happens. I couldnâ€™t hel...

item.title: 5 Years of Software Engineering
item.description:
Here I briefly document the first 5 years of my software engineering career.
I wrote my first line of code in 2020 and while I still have a lot to learn, I am now at a spot where I can build things from the ground up that some other engineers find useful. I will outline a rough summary of some of the key points that helped me get here to reflect upon and to serve as reference for those who care.
2020
Take my first programming class CS 1371, computing for engineers in my second semester of fre...
